intro: Phelipanche stenosiphon, commonly known as the narrow-siphon morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. Due to its invasive nature, it can become a problematic weed in agricultural and natural ecosystems.
